meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound or signal
meanings.sent1: The machine made loud bleeps when it finished its work.
meanings.sent2: I heard a series of bleeps coming from the kitchen timer.
meanings.sent3: The bleeps of the alarm clock woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The bleeps of the digital watch were like tiny birds chirping.
meanings.sent5: The bleeps of the microwave were like musical notes in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To censor or obscure offensive language in a broadcast
meanings.sent1: The TV station had to bleep out the swear words during the live show.
meanings.sent2: They decided to bleep the inappropriate language in the movie for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made a joke that made the crew bleep out his punchline.
meanings.sent4: The radio host had to bleep a caller who used foul language on air.
meanings.sent5: The editor had to bleep a few lines in the article before publishing it.

meanings.definition: To emit a series of short, high-pitched sounds
meanings.sent1: The toy robot bleeps happily as it moves around the room.
meanings.sent2: The machine bleeps to indicate that it needs attention.
meanings.sent3: The bird outside my window seems to bleep along with the alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: The computer bleeps softly to let you know it's ready to use.
meanings.sent5: The car bleeps to remind you to fasten your seatbelt before driving.
